definition: widowed/lit. broken string, cf 琴瑟[qin2 se4] qin and se, two instruments epitomizing marital harmony
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
bow string/string of musical instrument/watchspring/chord (segment of curve)/hypotenuse/CL:根[gen1]

sentences.english: The broken strings of Vina sing no more your praise.
sentences.chinese: 七弦琴的断弦不再弹唱你的荣耀。

sentences.english: Musset who took off the piano strings, not knowing where to go fly.
sentences.chinese: 缪塞们，拿着断弦的琴，不知道飞到哪里去了。

definition: string (of a stringed instrument)
bow string/string of musical instrument/watchspring/chord (segment of curve)/hypotenuse/CL:根[gen1]
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
qin and se, two string instruments that play in perfect harmony/marital harmony
to play the zither/classical variant of 彈琴|弹琴[tan2 qin2]
guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
to tighten the strings (of a musical instrument)
konghou (Chinese harp)
lingering sound
(phonetics) voiceless sound
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither
pipa, Chinese lute, with 4 strings, a large pear-shaped body and a fretted fingerboard
reverberates around the rafters (idiom); fig. sonorous and resounding (esp. of singing voice)
reed-pipe wind instrument and vertical bamboo flute

to play the xiao 簫|箫[xiao1] (mouth organ)/to beg while playing pipes; cf politician Wu Zixu 伍子胥[Wu3 Zi3 xu1], c. 520 BC destitute refugee in Wu town, 吳市吹簫|吴市吹箫[Wu2 shi4 chui1 xiao1]/to busk/virtuoso piper wins a beauty, cf 玉人吹簫|玉人吹箫[yu4 ren2 chui1 xiao1]/(slang) fellatio/blowjob
hard to play (of music for stringed instrument)
